document.title: MARYLAND WORLD-READINESS STANDARDS FOR LEARNING LANGUAGES

630B68DD2E0541F286AC660463886BBF.description:
Learners can write
about complex and
abstract issues ranging
from topics of broad
general interests to areas
of specialized expertise
using standard structure,
lexicon, and writing
protocols.

79C7FA1DA2094564BA21C0C9D84C57CB.description:
Learners can write
extensively with
significant precision
and detail on a variety
of topics, most
complex issues, and
some special fields of
expertise.

AFCBE2007CAB409CAC5186BD4CF2F674.description:
Learners can write
organized paragraphs about
events and experiences in
various time frames.

FCE67DABC13A43FF800B46FF1A0D17EC.description:
Learners can write on
general interest, academic,
and professional topics.

1115BB5E4D0E4F6FB2F381539AC00AF0.description:
Learners can present
information about events
and experiences in
various time frames.

FE1697C5E6164A3797DD1FA144195CCF.description:
Learners can deliver
organized presentations,
appropriate to their
audience, on a variety of
topics.

699EF8EC279E4F19B3423E061582A41B.description:
Learners can write
some simple paragraphs
about events and
experiences in various
time frames.

0E8A3D3C40D54EDAAA1412D4771CB219.description:
Learners can write on
topics related to school,
work, and community in
a generally organized
way.

6CA79E73FA754398BF85C39C91BB9311.description:
Learners can write on
a wide variety of familiar
topics using connected
sentences.

481853E085D1469CB2876DD06076E900.description:
Learners can write
briefly about most
familiar topics and
present information using
a series of simple
sentences.

DC70CF88BB514E63B13DD21426BEE24D.description:
Learners can write
short messages and notes
on familiar topics related
to everyday life.

8A28DC0EE1D446DE99413F0BCB53E142.description:
Learners can write lists
and memorized phrases
on familiar topics.

22732849851F4D24B2932D045FEF3C1C.description:
Learners can copy
some familiar words,
characters, or phrases.

89097E58934446918A1FF3BC7825BEFA.description:
PRESENTATIONAL WRITING: Learners present information, concepts, and ideas to inform, explain, persuade, and narrate on a variety of topics using appropriate media and adapting to various audiences of listeners,
readers, or viewers.

2666177E0DCC4F3B859787B6A17223C1.description:
Learners can deliver
detailed presentations
with accuracy, clarity,
and precision to a wide
variety of audiences on
topics and issues ranging
from broad general
interests to areas of
specialized expertise.

B2665578B10C4771B8977C2ADA0EB1F8.description:
Learners can deliver
detailed presentations,
usually with accuracy,
clarity, and precision,
on a variety of topics
and issues related to
community interests
and some special fields
of expertise.

07AA33CE82194D59B8553DEC51459C90.description:
Learners can present
detailed information about
events and experiences in
various time frames.

CCF078CA559342258F421DFECB1F6172.description:
Learners can deliver
well-organized
presentations on concrete
social, academic, and
professional topics.

87AB412A32204CE9ABB3B7D054EF6A0B.description:
Learners can present
information about events
and experiences in
various time frames.

E82E4362E46A441EB8698395F706B9F6.description:
Learners can deliver
organized presentations,
appropriate to their
audience, on a variety of
topics.

3DC4CFB0A31942D1B2D0D6644032878D.description:
Learners can make
presentations on some
events and experiences in
various time frames.

AD9AC0DD68E54B92B69C732B9CD85098.description:
Learners can make
presentations in a
generally organized way
on school, work, and
community topics, and
on topics they have
researched.

7634DBFDA7ED4CA0A9030EA52005BF42.description:
Learners can make
presentations on a wide
variety of familiar topics
using connected
sentences.

EFEDFA4ABF354B95AFD11056DEB466F9.description:
Learners can present
information on most
familiar topics using a
series of simple
sentences.

56B78AD83FB748C595F4DC56198EAB26.description:
Learners can present
basic information on
familiar topics using
language they have
practiced using phrases
and simple sentences.

141192EEE5CB4B39B10814A421CE9E7B.description:
Learners can present
information about themselves and some other
very familiar topics using
a variety of words,
phrases, and memorized
expressions.

F2863648594D4D0398830C233E7DE221.description:
Learners can present
information about themselves and some other
very familiar topics using
single words or
memorized phrases.

58ACC4BAC2674F058632032E9B4F1680.description:
PRESENTATIONAL SPEAKING: Learners present information, concepts, and ideas to inform, explain, persuade, and narrate on a variety of topics using appropriate media and adapting to various audiences of listeners,
readers, or viewers.

DC1F0B3E8CCB4656946B27EE1F3248F5.description:
Learners can
sometimes infer complex
meaning that requires
analysis and deep
understanding of the
culture.

EFA1B076CB9242DAABC012D65D9C8DB5.description:
Learners can follow
academic, professional,
and literary texts on a
wide range of both
familiar and unfamiliar
subjects.

CF78BD0507D04328B8383E22854FE720.description:
Learners can
sometimes understand
extended arguments and
different points of view.

BE6E9288B5C041C9B65248101273D803.description:
Learners can
understand what they
read on most topics that
deal with special
interests, unfamiliar
situations, and abstract
concepts.

B7AB5BDF85A74B318C96C315FDD719A0.description:
Learners can easily
follow narrative,
informational, and
descriptive texts.

7097204474AB4E1BA6D668F641FCE6D0.description:
Learners can
understand texts written
in a variety of genres,
even when they are
unfamiliar with the topic.

8F0FC4854B4C435FB8DA78C3939F3753.description:
Learners can follow
stories and descriptions of
considerable length and
in various time frames.

8CA1091CA87E454DB4F2326EC0BD17A1.description:
Learners can
understand the main idea
and most supporting
details in texts on a
variety of topics of
personal and general
interest, as well as some
professional topics.

DB9F5604CBC143FA885BA09BA6CECA58.description:
Learners can follow
stories and descriptions of
some length and in
various time frames and
genres.

FA5CEA70A9B54AD79BB02EA084495351.description:
Learners can
understand the main idea
and some supporting
details on a variety of
topics of personal and
general interest.

3CC47C10C4FD424AA07FBB414D91FCCF.description:
Learners can
sometimes follow stories
and descriptions about
events and experiences in
various time frames.

B971F3B316394BE7BA3FCD575A6D6577.description:
Learners can easily
understand the main idea
of texts related to
everyday life, personal
interests, and studies.

FE2C2C62E42845ADA27E72B40370CBDC.description:
Learners can
understand the main
idea of texts related to
everyday life and
personal interests or
studies.

7E44B6AF49154306B7AB84A64094C96A.description:
Learners can
understand the main idea
of short and simple texts
when the topic is
familiar.

A2F0183E531D4C848B36148235392883.description:
Learners can
sometimes understand the
main idea of what they
have read.

9039A7C73265475A9B8A5828F62F7CEC.description:
Learners can
understand familiar
words, phrases, and
sentences within short and
simple texts related to
everyday life.

005458889DAC49E5BB4918A2BCEFD831.description:
Learners can
understand some learned
or memorized words and
phrases when they read.

214D66B40CEB41F58D7912FEFB96D7A0.description:
Learners can recognize
some letters or characters.

A04F347D246B47DDA26621E389D459CB.description:
Learners can identify a
few memorized words and
phrases when they read.

62154660B05348B7B1734DB18E607F4A.description:
Learners can recognize
a few letters or characters.

639AE70A3D384658A7F65DF113D1A5CF.description: INTERPRETIVE READING: Learners understand, interpret, and analyze what is heard, read, or viewed on a variety of topics.

2FD436443DEB4F728AE22BC416FBE5F7.description:
Learners can
sometimes infer complex
meaning that requires
deep understanding of the
culture.

E8D69F69BF144B639E30A6A4C1527FC9.description:
Learners can
understand all standard
dialects.

BC03ACC59F41488197CA91908F316549.description:
Learners can follow a
wide range of academic
and professional
discourse on abstract and
specialized topics.

B3BD46387C7C43A7BD16F2FC0AC2E192.description:
Learners can
sometimes follow
extended arguments and
different points of view.

6FF1E296B6934E39A44F4DBCD23855FA.description:
Learners can
understand discussions on
most topics that deal with
special interests,
unfamiliar situations, and
abstract concepts.

FBBC7F2A74D542E69FC3366D01ACFC47.description:
Learners can easily
follow narrative,
informational, and
descriptive speech.

B8F9F56737E34A28B62F975FB2140849.description:
Learners can
understand information
presented in most genres,
even when not familiar
with the topic.

1D3A7F5A64F44466AF5CF9BCC5366330.description:
Learners can follow
stories and descriptions of
some length and in
various time frames.

4C3335F569B44A67BE7F2E61CD339D1D.description:
Learners can
understand the main idea
and most supporting
detail on a variety of
topics of personal and
general interest, as well
as some topics of
professional interest.

517B7D04C11C4B60991CB662A4326EA4.description:
Learners can
understand information
presented in a variety of
genres on familiar topics,
even when something
unexpected is expressed.

D26872BBFE6D4EF49572D276785EF3E0.description:
Learners can follow
stories and descriptions of
some length and in
various time frames.

A6D41EBEDFC445EBB5AB0F098C488902.description:
Learners can understand the main idea and
some supporting details
in organized speech on a
variety of topics of
personal and general
interest.

C5D8140238A24A5BAF84D80BC0B7D0E6.description:
Learners can
sometimes follow what
they hear about events
and experiences in
various time frames.

0376D153CD3849329D74A9CE132BFB17.description:
Learners can usually
understand a few details
of what they overhear in
conversations, even when
something unexpected is
expressed.

F3875C94CF604A139DCA2ACA89C9CBAE.description:
Learners can easily
understand the main idea
in messages and
presentations on a variety
of topics related to
everyday life and
personal interests and
studies.

B6560D139A474CBF8B2264AB65BC9AB6.description:
Learners can
understand the main idea
in conversations that they
overhear.

FF43C8DFF89447A487D9A1BCD14E70E8.description:
Learners can
understand the main idea
in messages and
presentations on a variety
of topics related to
everyday life and
personal interests and
studies.

A5CFE1CC82E04F04AB21F35D81A7CB74.description:
Learners can
understand the main idea
of simple conversations
that they overhear.

ADB307A1595B409CB22D7623CF1B8841.description:
Learners can
understand the main idea
in messages and
presentations on a variety
of topics related to
everyday life and
personal interests and
studies.

2F3FF7862AF24946BC1AE2FB3A052310.description:
Learners can recognize
pieces of information and
sometimes understand the
main topic of what is
being said.

8673DFAE5BC34AB687519235FBB707E2.description:
Learners can often
understand words,
phrases, and simple
sentences related to
everyday life.

9740229DD5CD4F01A62B90EBB0E62CD0.description:
Learners can recognize
some familiar words and
phrases when they hear
them spoken.

66F2ADE827914EBE9D382408BF7BE7B1.description:
Learners can recognize
a few memorized words
and phrases when they
hear them spoken.

7595F5915CC6446F9D74455D065B1705.description: INTERPRETIVE LISTENING: Learners understand, interpret, and analyze what is heard, read, or viewed on a variety of topics.

9A4B2B85BDE347BA9AE0709DC3D9D1D2.description:
Learners can discuss at
length complex issues by
structuring arguments and
developing hypotheses.

D82201327D29491BA9B60F5852871C25.description:
Learners can
participate fully and
effectively in discussions
on a variety of topics in
formal and informal
settings.

8D978434035742B6920B42CE8F6CC8E3.description:
Learners can
communicate with ease,
accuracy, and fluency.

ECD99B92B59A408A9B7C1245FA55241B.description:
Learners can usually
support their opinion and
develop hypotheses on
topics of particular
interest or personal
expertise.

71EE78473ACD4A68944EEE35B86F2D74.description:
Learners can express
themselves freely and
spontaneously, and for
the most part accurately,
on concrete topics and on
most complex issues.

61200E436B8B4D65B2F6A52A16089643.description:
Learners can share
their points of view in
discussions on some
complex issues.

8663F2E61B744C89A63BFE6F1CFCCE4D.description:
Learners can
confidently handle
routine situations with an
unexpected complication.

AA88FAE37AC948F2B26851ED879933A9.description:
Learners can talk in
detail and in an organized
way about events and
experiences in various
time frames.

B946AE8A6E334251B9A8AB1A71CB56CE.description:
Learners can express
themselves fully not only
on familiar topics but also
on some concrete social,
academic, and
professional topics.

748013B772BE49DBAA52E8AA10AAB5F6.description:
Learners can handle a
familiar situation with an
unexpected complication.

2DB9BBEE84894FB792E4A71B68F5CFEE.description:
Learners can describe
people, places, and things
in an organized way and
with some detail.

304DCB7419724AD3A745489F5796B33D.description:
Learners can talk in an
organized way and with
some detail about events
and experiences in
various time frames.

89DDC50EE4EE4778A822CF80AB317680.description:
Learners can
participate in
conversations about
familiar topics that go
beyond their everyday
lives.

AF98ABC2567A46559C7897ECD4139F66.description:
Learners can handle
social interactions in
everyday situations,
sometimes even when
there is an unexpected
complication.

5325FC354CAC4E148A178DBF674AF9AD.description:
Learners can usually
describe people, places,
and things.

EEE491CC8D8540988A2B22433B351F4B.description:
Learners can usually
talk about events and
experiences in various
time frames.

1519365B56D0458F975E44A3AFFA338F.description:
Learners can
participate with ease and
confidence in
conversations on familiar
topics.

2580D9E84F9441EE86259DA2F917E961.description:
Learners can usually
say what they want to say
about themselves and
their everyday lives.

12F375FA368F44299E33306726EBECE0.description:
Learners can handle
short social interactions
in everyday situations by
asking and answering a
variety of questions.

0463E7C13FA8420C8761345DA62B24B0.description:
Learners can
participate in
conversations on familiar
topics using sentences
and series of sentences.

A8ADBBB6DF584CD38D14EFBA7E3E7306.description:
Learners can handle
short social interactions
in everyday situations by
asking and answering
simple questions.

19D9A83E389B45A282EA2CBC8D5756CA.description:
Learners can
participate in
conversations on a
number of familiar topics
using simple sentences.

E57B0B39155346E089886344E3FD5F44.description:
Learners can usually
handle short social
interactions in everyday
situations by asking and
answering simple
questions.

FE439D39B7D74162B19DF9362674FB2F.description:
Learners can communicate and exchange
information about familiar
topics using phrases and
simple sentences
sometimes supported by
memorized language.

2B2740C3131E493697B414F3945E3DAF.description:
Learners can
communicate on very
familiar topics using a
variety of words and
phrases that they have
practiced and memorized.

2C57FE97F29640EDAF097FEE0EB7293B.description:
Learners can
communicate on some
very familiar topics using
single words and phrases
that they have practiced
and memorized.

BF29B21F0FF54A3DAAD7555ABAB8818F.description: Learners interact and negotiate meaning in spoken, signed, or written conversations to share information, reactions, feelings, and opinions.

153F4792C4BD44C7A1DD6FEAC9E9932F.description: COMMUNICATION: Learners communicate effectively in more than one language in order to function in a variety of situations and for multiple purposes.
